posts.post_content:
Although Innistrad was, despite some rumors, not going to play on Ravnica again (but on Innistrad, duh!), *Ghost Quarter* just suits this set perfectly, i dare to say even better than [the previous one](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=107504).

Posted By: Hunter06 (1/6/2013 10:33:22 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Erm, Jimmycricket, you mean 25 times?  
'ahem'...  
  
Anyway! In truth, this is, as everyone's saying, a discount legacy solution to Urza Saga Lands ([Gaea's Cradle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gaea's Cradle), [Serra Sanctum](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Sanctum), [Tolarian Academy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tolarian Academy)) and the Urza Lands ([Power Plant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Power Plant), [Mine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mine), [Tower](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tower)). It's playable in Modern, and is uncounterable and can activate the turn it comes out... even on turn 1. It might be a decent card to sideboard against Urzatron.  
  
Worst case scenario, you sacrifice your own land to even out whatever you're looking for.
posts.html:
Erm, Jimmycricket, you mean 25 times?
'ahem'...

Anyway! In truth, this is, as everyone's saying, a discount legacy solution to Urza Saga Lands (Gaea's Cradle, Serra Sanctum, Tolarian Academy) and the Urza Lands (Power Plant, Mine, Tower). It's playable in Modern, and is uncounterable and can activate the turn it comes out... even on turn 1. It might be a decent card to sideboard against Urzatron.

Worst case scenario, you sacrifice your own land to even out whatever you're looking for.

posts.post_content: After watching the finals from Pro Tour: RtR, I now know this is not a land destruction card. This is a ramping card. The new land comes in untapped...tap a land, play and sac Ghost Quarter targeting the tapped land, then perhaps tap [Deathrite Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathrite Shaman)? Poof, three mana in almost any color combination you may need. I need to take another look at this card now...
posts.html:
After watching the finals from Pro Tour: RtR, I now know this is not a land destruction card. This is a ramping card. The new land comes in untapped...tap a land, play and sac Ghost Quarter targeting the tapped land, then perhaps tap Deathrite Shaman? Poof, three mana in almost any color combination you may need.
